shots.sentence: I made a coding agent using Python and Olamma that runs on my 4-year-old MacBook M1.
shots.notes: Strong opening title screen to introduce the project and platform.

shots.sentence: This was a great learning experience to understand how more advanced coding agents like Cloud Code, cursor and GitHub Copilot works under the hood.
shots.notes: Use TextScreen to list the key competitors/inspirations.

shots.sentence: It also showcases how small and local 8B models, like when 8B, that can literally run on your hardware for free, perform under different coding tasks.

compositionProps.text: Local 8B Models: Run FREE on Your Hardware

shots.notes: Typewriter effect to emphasize the key takeaway about local, free models.

shots.sentence: This coding agent has a very minimal set of tools.
shots.notes: Simple title card for a section break.

shots.sentence: The agent has access to the following tools. The most used tools are red file, list files, edit file and run command tools.

compositionProps.longMultiLineText:
Read File
List Files
Edit File
Run Command

shots.notes: List the core tools the agent uses.

shots.sentence: It essentially runs in a loop as long as there are tool calls and responses.
shots.notes: Emphasize the 'loop' mechanism with a dynamic text display.

shots.sentence: For example, in the first response, it might try to read the project structure using list files tool. The result from list files is then again fed to the LLM, then it finds the file it wants to change.
shots.notes: First step in the loop: using the 'list files' tool. Use a terminal/bash simulation.

shots.sentence: For example, main.py in a Python project. And then it uses read file tool to read the code in that file.

steps.title: 2. Read File Tool (main.py)

shots.notes: Second step: using the 'read file' tool, showing code content.

shots.sentence: In the next loop step, it tries to edit the file using edit file or write file tool and make the changes.

steps.title: 3. Edit File Tool

shots.notes: Third step: using the 'edit file' tool, showing a code change.

shots.sentence: Once LLM thinks it has completed the task in the user prompt, it stops the tool calls and responds with more questions for future tasks or a summary of what it has done.
shots.notes: Final conclusion screen with an avatar for a personal touch.
